Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameEngine
  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to run the Amazons program, containing methods to play the game, simulate games, as well the tutorial and review game options.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      GameEngine()

        Defining and initialising 2 player objects, either AI or human, depending on how many are specified
        Parameters:
        noOfHumanPlayers - The number of humanPlayer objects required
        Returns:
        A list of 2 Player objects

      • setupBoard

        private Board setupBoard​(int boardSize,
                         java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Defining and initialising a new Board object, filling it with pieces and giving the pieces to the correct player objects
        Parameters:
        boardSize - Size of the board required
        players - List of players to give the pieces to
        Returns:
        a Board object, ready to be used for a game

      • chooseFirstPlayer

        private Player chooseFirstPlayer​(Player p1,
                                 Player p2)
        Chooses the first player, depending on who has the white pieces.
        Parameters:
        p1 - First player object
        p2 - Second player object
        Returns:
        The player with the white pieces, to play first.

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard​(Move nextMove,
                        Board board,
                        boolean printBoard)
        Updating a board, with move that has been selected by a player.
        Parameters:
        nextMove - Move to be played
        board - Board to update
        printBoard - boolean used to indicate if the board should be printed or not

      • swapPlayers

        public Player swapPlayers​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                          Player currentPlayer)
        Gets the other player, given the player who was the last "currentPlayer"
        Parameters:
        players - List of 2 player objects
        currentPlayer - Player who played last
        Returns:
        Player object indicating who will play next

      • outputGameFile

        public void outputGameFile​(java.util.ArrayList<Move> movesPlayed,
                           Board board)
        Writing a finished games gameFile to disk.
        Parameters:
        movesPlayed - A list of the moves played in the completed game.
        board - The board that the game was played on.

      • finishGame

        private void finishGame​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                        Player currentPlayer,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Move> movesPlayed,
                        Board board)
        Outputting the winner of the game, and exiting the program.
        Parameters:
        players - List of the 2 player objects
        currentPlayer - The player who lost
        movesPlayed - The number of moves made
        board - The board played on

      • startGame

        public void startGame​(Board board,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Move> movesPlayed,
                      Player currentPlayer,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Playing through a game, once the board and players have been initialised
        Parameters:
        board - The board that will be used for the game
        movesPlayed - A list to store the moves that have been played
        currentPlayer - Stores the player who is next to move
        players - List of the 2 players for the game

      • playGame

        public void playGame​(IO io,
                     GameEngine engine)
        Setup the game, play through it and output the gameFile to file
        Parameters:
        io - Input/Output object, used for console I/O
        engine - GameEngine, providing essential game methods

      • inputGameFile

        public GameFile inputGameFile()
        Retrieving a gameFile from disk, allowing it to be reviewed.
        Returns:
        A GameFile object for the most recently played game

      • outputCGTExplanation

        public void outputCGTExplanation​(Board board)
        Checks if a given board object can be evaluated fully, using the combinatorial game theory strategy. If it can, outputs the game value associated with each partition, the boards game value and the move options for both players.
        Parameters:
        board -

      • reviewGame

        public void reviewGame​(IO io,
                       GameEngine engine)
        Reviewing a game, allowing the user to go through the moves in the most recent game, navigating forwards and backwards through moves or selecting a specific move number.
        Parameters:
        io - Input/Output object, used for console I/O
        engine - GameEngine, providing essential game methods

      • tutorial

        public void tutorial​(IO io,
                     java.lang.String[] Args)
        A quick tutorial allowing a user to learn how to play the Amazons game.
        Parameters:
        io - Input/Output object, used for console I/O
        Args - List of command-line arguments

      • simulateGames

        public int simulateGames​(int noOfSimulations,
                         java.lang.String AIType1,
                         java.lang.String AIType2)
        Simulates experiment games, with 2 types of AI, to compare their performance.
        Parameters:
        noOfSimulations - The number of games that will be simulated
        AIType1 - The first AI strategy used
        AIType2 - The second AI strategy used
        Returns:
        The number of times the first AI strategy wins
